metadata.title: RHSA-2009:1471 -- elinks security update (Important)
metadata.description: An updated elinks package that fixes two security issues is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 and 5. This update has been rated as having important security impact by the Red Hat Security Response Team. ELinks is a text-based Web browser. ELinks does not display any images, but it does support frames, tables, and most other HTML tags. An off-by-one buffer overflow flaw was discovered in the way ELinks handled its internal cache of string representations for HTML special entities. A remote attacker could use this flaw to create a specially-crafted HTML file that would cause ELinks to crash or, possibly, execute arbitrary code when rendered. (CVE-2008-7224)

criteria.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 release section

extend_definition.comment: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4

criteria.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and CentOS Linux 5 release section

extend_definition.comment: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5
The operating system installed on the system is CentOS Linux 5.x
